maintext.text:
Commander, Robin here.

C.U.R.E. sent me to the lab to archive the samples.

I'm supposed to prepare everything for transport to the surface.

leftButton.lbText: Good to hear from you. I was starting to worry. I transferred control of the station to C.U.R.E.

rightButton.rbText: Finally I'm hearing from you. C.U.R.E. took control of the station from me.

maintext.text:
Yes, that's what I thought.
He locked the Professor in the airlock and then sent me here right away.
The situation is making me a little nervous.
Can't you get control back from him?
Or shut down his system?

leftButton.lbText: I've tried that. Oddly, he's refusing my orders.

rightButton.rbText: Maybe we should just let him do his thing. He seems to be efficient.

maintext.text:
I don't think that's a good idea.

C.U.R.E. has control over all the systems.
That includes life support.
I'm not comfortable with the thought of my fate being in the hands of a computer.

leftButton.lbText: But that's exactly what he was created for.

rightButton.rbText: You're right. We need to take back control from him.

maintext.text: That might be true, but just imagine what he might do if he starts to consider us a threat to the mission. I don't even want to think about it.

leftButton.lbText: Then let's act inconspicuous and try to take back control without alerting him.

rightButton.rbText: Then we're better off just doing what he says.

maintext.text:
If he starts working against us, there's only one way out:

We need to deactivate his central memory.
Although for that I need to get into the server room.

leftButton.lbText: That sounds very risky.

rightButton.rbText: Then what are we waiting for. Make your way there.

maintext.text:
There's only one problem:
Now that the escalation protocol is active C.U.R.E. can do whatever he wants.

Once he notices that we want to sabotage him...

leftButton.lbText: Say no more. I can imagine how that's gonna end.

rightButton.rbText:
Eh, you can do it.
I'm sure he won't hurt you.

maintext.text:
If he activates his defense mechanisms, or creates a vacuum in the server room, you won't have anyone left to talk to and the mission is over.

We need to think of something else.

leftButton.lbText: You're right. Let me think. Can you move freely around the station?

rightButton.rbText:
Alright.
Let's postpone that plan.
In any case, are you able to leave the lab?

maintext.text:
I think so.

The door to the corridor doesn't seem to be locked.

What do you have in mind?

leftButton.lbText:
Okay, listen up:
You need to free the Professor.

rightButton.rbText:
Okay, listen up:
We need to talk to the Professor.

maintext.text:
Why that?

He would've let me suffocate out there, just to keep me from bringing the samples on board the station.

leftButton.lbText: He must know something that can help us out. Why would he act like that otherwise.

rightButton.rbText: He seemed very strange to me when we were talking. Almost as if he wasn't himself.

maintext.text:
Maybe you're right.

He seems to know more about these samples than us.

Even though I can't stand him, I still would like to find out what he knows and ask him why he's behaving like that.

leftButton.lbText: Good, then start making your way directly to the airlock now.

rightButton.rbText:
Good, then go find him.
But take an indirect route so that C.U.R.E. doesn't immediately get suspicious.

maintext.text:
Understood.

I'll be on my way and contact you once I'm there.
Wish me luck, okay?
And if you hear from C.U.R.E. try and buy me some time.

Over and Out.

leftButton.lbText: Over and Out.

maintext.text:
Commander,
you were talking to Dr. Muller.

What are you planning?

I hope you're not thinking of doing something foolish?

leftButton.lbText:
[lie]

Uhm, nope.
Why?

rightButton.rbText:
You probably know already...

We want to talk to the Professor.

maintext.text:
Commander,
please do not underestimate me, tell me exactly what it is that you are planning.

leftButton.lbText:
[lie]

Uhm, nothing much.
Don't worry.

rightButton.rbText:
You were eavesdropping again, weren't you?

Okay, we want to talk to the Professor.

maintext.text:
Commander,
you are not lying to me, are you?

You should know by now that I would notice that.

leftButton.lbText:
[lie]

Nah, never.
Wouldn't dream of it.

rightButton.rbText:
Okay, okay.

We want to talk to the Professor.

maintext.text:
Thank you for your honesty,
Commander.

Goodbye.

leftButton.lbText:
C.U.R.E.?

Hello?

rightButton.rbText: Oh, you're welcome.

maintext.text:
Commander,
I know what you are doing.
You want to talk to the Professor.

You believe he can answer your questions.

That is why you have sent Dr. Muller to the airlock.

leftButton.lbText:
[lie]

Oh my, don't you have a lively imagination.

rightButton.rbText:
Yes,
that's exactly true.

leftButton.lbText:
Wait!
I'll tell you.
We want to talk to the Professor!

rightButton.rbText:
C.U.R.E.?

Hello?

maintext.text:
Commander,
I've arrived at the airlock.

The door controls don't seem to be functional, but there's a small window in the door.

leftButton.lbText: Can you see the Professor inside?

rightButton.rbText: How is the Professor?

maintext.text:
Yes, he's standing with his back to me and is staring through the porthole out into the darkness.

I'm trying to reach him on the communicator so you can talk to him.

leftButton.lbText: Good idea, do that.

rightButton.rbText: Okay, hurry.

maintext.text:
Professor, can you hear me?

Please respond.

Dr. Muller, Commander...

Where are the samples?
Are they on this station?

leftButton.lbText:
Yes, Professor.
Dr. Muller moved them to the laboratory.

rightButton.rbText: That is none of your business anymore, Professor.

maintext.text: That is unfortunate.
Why? What is going on with you?

The samples, they contain something akin to genetic material, a unique DNA sequence, far superior to ours. It is the secret of this planet...
and its inhabitants.

leftButton.lbText:
Inhabitants?
I thought we were completely alone here.

rightButton.rbText:
Now he's completely lost his marbles.
There's nothing here but us and water.
Lots of water.

maintext.text:
That is the typical arrogance of humanity.
Always thinking we're alone in the universe.
But our probes showed no signs of life, we've been scanning for months.

leftButton.lbText:
Robin is right.
We don't have any information to corroborate the existence of any other lifeforms on this planet.

rightButton.rbText: That's a waste of time!

maintext.text:
Well, we haven't really looked for them correctly...
The inhabitants are not like us, they're not carbon-based and don't possess a solid form.
They're just there. They exist without being bound to a fixed place.

leftButton.lbText:
Professor,
how do you presume to know all this?

rightButton.rbText: You just made that all up.

maintext.text: These beings, they're already here.
You mean the've reached the station?

No, no, they're here...
...
In me.
...
And also in...

leftButton.lbText:
Robin.
Get away from the door.

rightButton.rbText: That's enough.

maintext.text:
Soon after our arrival they bonded with me, showed me what this planet means to them.

They live in symbiosis with their planet.

They are a part of it, just as the planet is a part of them.

leftButton.lbText: Are you saying that you're under the influence of these beings?

rightButton.rbText: Are we speaking to Professor Orlow or these beings?

maintext.text:
I became a part of them and they became part of me.
…
…
…
Which means that I cannot allow the samples to leave this planet.

leftButton.lbText:
Listen to me, Professor:
It's all going to be fine. Robin will bring you to the sick bay now, okay?

rightButton.rbText:
We're lucky that C.U.R.E. locked you in there.
You might be contagious!

maintext.text: I'll try to short-circuit the door controls, then I'm getting you out of there.

Commander, if I get out of here, I guarantee you that I will try everything in my power to stop you.
Everything.
Do you understand?

leftButton.lbText:
Robin, leave the Professor locked in there.
We need to get the samples off the station.

rightButton.rbText:
Everything? Really?
Then it might be best if I send you right back to your friends out there!

maintext.text:
Do as you wish, Commander. For you cannot stop us anymore.

My life is insignificant compared to what I'll be after I've left behind this fragile human shell.

leftButton.lbText:
Robin,
get away from there.
Leave the Professor to his fate.

rightButton.rbText:
Robin,
open the exterior door and flood the airlock.
That's not the Professor anymore.

maintext.text:
Okay, I'll just leave him to rot in there.

At least he can't do us any harm while he's in there.

leftButton.lbText:
Exactly.
Now get away from there.

rightButton.rbText:
Yes.
Let C.U.R.E. take care of him.

maintext.text:
Are you sure?

That will kill him!

Maybe there's a way to save him?

leftButton.lbText:
That was an order.
Flood the airlock.

Now!

rightButton.rbText:
All right.
Then just leave him locked in there.

maintext.text: Farewell, Commander.

Professor!?
No!
Stop, don't do it!

leftButton.lbText:
Robin,
what is he doing?

rightButton.rbText: Professor?

maintext.text:
Okay, Commander.
I'm flooding it.
…
Water is shooting into the airlock.
The Professor… he's being whirled around...
He's being sucked outside...
I can't see him anymore!

leftButton.lbText: That was the right decision, otherwise he would have put you in danger.

rightButton.rbText: Well done, otherwise he would have endangered our mission.

maintext.text:
He opened the exterior door and flooded the airlock.
...
...
He was sucked out, Commander.

But why did he do that?

leftButton.lbText:
He sacrificed himself for us.
He wanted to protect us from whatever was manipulating him, from whatever was inside him.

rightButton.rbText:
He fled.
He wasn't the Professor anymore, and now he's returned to the place he came from.

maintext.text:
Listen.
This is all too much for me right now.
…
…
…
I need a minute.

Over and Out.

leftButton.lbText: Over and Out.

maintext.text: ***offline***

leftButton.lbText: [wait]

maintext.text:
Commander,
there is nobody available to talk to at this time.

Goodbye.

leftButton.lbText: [wait]
